name: Jirachi
flavorText: Generations have believed that any wish written on a note on its head will come true when it awakens.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Jirachi from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip 3 coins. For each heads, search your discard pile for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to Jirachi.
Attack1Text: Choose a number of your opponent's Stage 1 or Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon up to the amount of Energy attached to Jirachi. Remove the highest Stage Evolution card from each of those Pokémon and put those cards back into your opponent's hand.

name: Magmortar
flavorText: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.
Attack1Text: Discard the top 3 cards from your deck. This attack does 50 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Magmortar.

name: Manaphy
flavorText: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 5 cards.

name: Metagross
Ability1Text: If you have any Psychic Energy attached to your Active Pokémon, the Retreat Cost for that Pokémon is 0.
Attack2Text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Mismagius
flavorText: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Psychic Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Mismagius is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Octillery
flavorText: It traps foes with the suction cups on its tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Switch Octillery with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Politoed
flavorText: Whenever three or more of these get together, they sing in a loud voice that sounds like bellowing.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose a Water Pokémon on your Bench and switch it with your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Politoed is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin for each Water Pokémon you have in play. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Shaymin
flavorText: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Shaymin from your hand onto your Bench, you may move as many Energy cards attached to your Pokémon as you like to any of your other Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

name: Sudowoodo
flavorText: It disguises itself as a tree to avoid attack. It hates water, so it will disappear if it starts raining.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Fighting Energy attached to Sudowoodo.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Torterra
flavorText: Ancient people imagined that beneath the ground, a gigantic Torterra dwelled.
Attack1Text: Remove from Torterra the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Xatu
flavorText: In South America, it is said that its right eye sees the future and its left eye views the past.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Beedrill
flavorText: It can take down any opponent with its powerful poison stingers. It sometimes attacks in swarms.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is also Paralyzed.

name: Blastoise
flavorText: It deliberately makes itself heavy so it can withstand the recoil of the water jets it fires.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Water Energy attached to 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Blastoise is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Return 2 Water Energy attached to Blastoise to your hand. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Crobat
flavorText: The development of wings on its legs enables it to fly fast but also makes it tough to stop and rest.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Fearow
flavorText: It shoots itself suddenly high into the sky, then plummets down in one fell swoop to strike its prey.
Attack2Text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Floatzel
flavorText: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Floatzel. This power can't be used if Floatzel is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Kingdra
flavorText: It sleeps deep on the ocean floor to build its energy. It is said to cause tornadoes as it wakes.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: You may do 50 damage plus 30 more damage. If you do, return an Energy card attached to Kingdra to your hand.

name: Lanturn
flavorText: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea's surface from a depth of over three miles.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Move an Energy card attached to Lanturn to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Lucario
flavorText: It's said that no foe can remain invisible to Lucario, since it can detect auras, even foes it could not otherwise see.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, each of Lucario's attacks does 30 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Ninetales
flavorText: Some legends claim that each of its nine tails has its own unique type of special mystical power.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for up to 3 Fire Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Poliwrath
flavorText: Although an energetic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its muscles, it lives on dry land.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 40 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Primeape
flavorText: If approached while asleep, it may awaken and angrily give chase in a groggy state of semi-sleep.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Roserade
flavorText: Its sweet aroma attracts prey. Then it spews poison. The more toxic it is, the sweeter its aroma.
Ability1Text: When you attach a Grass Energy card or Psychic Energy card from your hand to Roserade during your turn, you may use this power. If you attach a Grass Energy card, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If you attach a Psychic Energy card, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Roserade is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Roserade.

name: Steelix
flavorText: Its body has been compressed deep under the ground. As a result, it is even harder than a diamond.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Steelix by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

name: Torkoal
flavorText: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Torkoal from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Tyranitar
flavorText: Extremely strong, it can change the landscape. It has an insolent nature that makes it not care about others.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Ursaring
flavorText: With its ability to distinguish any aroma, it unfailing finds all food buried deep underground.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Cherrim
flavorText: During times of strong sunlight, its bud blooms, its petals open fully, and it becomes very active.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 1 damage counter from your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Cherrim is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Dunsparce
flavorText: When spotted, this Pokémon escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.
Attack1Text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

name: Golbat
flavorText: It can drink more than 10 ounces of blood at once. If it has too much, it gets heavy and flies clumsily.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Grotle
flavorText: A Grotle that lives in the forest is said to have its own secret springwater.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Kakuna
flavorText: Although it is a cocoon, it can move a little. It can extend its poison barb if it is attacked.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Kakuna and put it onto Kakuna. (This counts as evolving Kakuna.) Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Metang
flavorText: When two Beldum fuse together, a magnetic nervous system places their brains in union.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Psychic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like.

name: Minun
flavorText: Exposure to electricity from Minun and Plusle promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: If Plusle is on your Bench, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Numel
flavorText: The flaming magma it stores in the hump on its back is the source of its tremendous power.
Attack1Text: Discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. Then, draw 3 cards.

name: Plusle
flavorText: It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out its body to create crackling noises.
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Plusle does 10 damage to itself.

name: Poliwhirl
flavorText: The skin on most of its body is moist. However, the skin on its belly spiral feels smooth.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Pupitar
flavorText: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.
Ability1Text: If Pupitar has any Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost of Pupitar is 0.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Pupitar.

name: Pupitar
flavorText: Even sealed in its shell, it can move freely. Hard and fast, it has outstanding destructive power.

name: Seadra
flavorText: Its fin tips leak poison. Its fins and bones are highly valued as ingredients in herbal medicine.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Tauros
flavorText: They fight each other by locking horns. The herd's protector takes pride in its battle-scarred horns.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. Tauros is now Confused.

name: Wartortle
flavorText: It is a well-established symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Aipom
flavorText: It lives atop tall trees. When leaping from branch to branch, it deftly uses its tail for balance.
Attack1Text: Move an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Beldum
flavorText: The magnetic force generated by its body repels the ground's natural magnetism, letting it float.
Attack1Text: You may switch Beldum with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Buizel
flavorText: It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Carnivine
flavorText: It walks around on its tentacles in search of a tree branch where it can dangle down and ambush prey.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Cherubi
flavorText: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.

name: Chinchou
flavorText: It shoots positive and negative electricity between the tips of its two antennae and zaps its enemies.

name: Horsea
flavorText: Its big, developed fins move rapidly, allowing it to swim backward while still facing forward.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Larvitar
flavorText: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck. Then, remove 2 damage counters from Larvitar.
Attack2Text: Larvitar does 10 damage to itself.

name: Larvitar
flavorText: It is born deep underground. It can't emerge until it has entirely consumed the soil around it.

name: Magmar
flavorText: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suitable for itself.

name: Mankey
flavorText: It is extremely ill-tempered. Groups of them will attack any handy target for no reason.
Attack2Text: Does 40 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Mankey.

name: Misdreavus
flavorText: It likes playing mischievous tricks such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Natu
flavorText: It usually forages for food on the ground but may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.
Attack2Text: Switch Natu with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Onix
flavorText: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
Ability1Text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to Onix, remove a damage counter from Onix.
Attack1Text: Onix can't attack during your next turn.

name: Onix
flavorText: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

name: Poliwag
flavorText: The direction of its belly spiral differs by area. The equator is thought to have an effect on this.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Remoraid
flavorText: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike even moving prey from more than 300 feet.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Riolu
flavorText: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Roselia
flavorText: Roselia that drink nutritionally rich springwater are said to reveal rare coloration when they bloom.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. Roselia is now Confused.

name: Spearow
flavorText: It flaps its short wings to flush out insects from tall grass. It then plucks them with its stubby beak.
Attack1Text: Remove 4 damage counters from Spearow. Spearow can't retreat during your next turn.

name: Squirtle
flavorText: The shell is soft when it is born. It soon becomes so resilient, prodding fingers will bounce off it.

name: Stantler
flavorText: The curved antlers subtly change the flow of air to create a strange space where reality is distorted.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Teddiursa
flavorText: Before food becomes scarce in wintertime, its habit is to hoard food in many hidden locations.
Attack1Text: Teddiursa does 10 damage to itself.

name: Tropius
flavorText: The bunch of fruit around its neck ripens twice a year and is delicious. It's a highly favored tropical snack.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Turtwig
flavorText: Photosynthesis occurs across its body under the sun. The shell on its back is actually hardened soil.
Attack1Text: If this attack does any damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), remove 1 damage counter from Turtwig.

name: Vulpix
flavorText: As it develops, its single white tail gains color and splits into six. It is quite warm and cuddly.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Vulpix.

name: Weedle
flavorText: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Weedle and put it onto Weedle. (This counts as evolving Weedle.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Zubat
flavorText: Capable of flying safely in dark places, it emits ultrasonic cries to check for any obstacles.
Attack2Text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Crobat
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Kingdra
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This power can't be used if Kingdra is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Fire Pokémon in play, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 60.

name: Lanturn
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Lanturn's type is Water until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Lanturn is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

name: Steelix
Ability1Text: Steelix can't be affected by any Special Conditions
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Steelix.
Attack2Text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

name: Tyranitar
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage to each Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) (excluding any Darkness Pokémon). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Ursaring
Ability1Text: If Ursaring has any damage counters on it, each of Ursaring's attacks does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Discard the top card from your opponent's deck.

name: Entei & Raikou LEGEND
Attack1Text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Entei & Raikou LEGEND.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy attached to Entei & Raikou LEGEND. This attack does 80 damage to each Pokémon that has any Poké-Powers (both yours and your opponent's). This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Entei & Raikou LEGEND
Attack1Text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Entei & Raikou LEGEND.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy attached to Entei & Raikou LEGEND. This attack does 80 damage to each Pokémon that has any Poké-Powers (both yours and your opponent's). This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Raikou & Suicune LEGEND
Attack1Text: Raikou & Suicune LEGEND does 50 damage to itself and don't apply Weakness to this damage.
Attack2Text: Remove 5 damage counters from Raikou & Suicune LEGEND.

name: Raikou & Suicune LEGEND
Attack1Text: Raikou & Suicune LEGEND does 50 damage to itself and don't apply Weakness to this damage.
Attack2Text: Remove 5 damage counters from Raikou & Suicune LEGEND.

name: Suicune & Entei LEGEND
Attack1Text: Return 2 Water Energy attached to Suicune & Entei LEGEND to your hand. Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Suicune & Entei LEGEND
Attack1Text: Return 2 Water Energy attached to Suicune & Entei LEGEND to your hand. Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.
